column2: The Empire of the East Indies
The Empire of the East Indies
The Empire of the East Indies
Our recently conquered territory has been fully integrated into our administration.

The unfortunate rebellion has left our administration in the gutter in Parliament's mind and a bill has recently passed liquidating the company, they now seek to sieze all of our holdings for the Crown.
The East India Company, run by fools as always has refused to the changing of hands of their holdings, for the good of the common Indian we must remove them by force.
The End of the East India Company

In the aftermath of the Sepoy Rebellion, under the provisions of the Government of India Act $YEAR$, the British Government nationalised the Company and thus the Crown took over its Indian possessions, its administrative powers and machinery, and its armed forces. The era of Company rule in India has come to an end. 

 It accomplished a work such as in the whole history of the human race no other trading Company ever attempted, and such as none, surely, is likely to attempt in the years to come. 

 - The Times

The British armies have been sent packing and we are now free to do with India as we see fit, our shareholders have moved to Calcutta and all of our affairs our strictly our own. Our forces have seized all British territory in Asia apart from Australia and New Zealand and all Princely states will be pressured to accept our suzerainty. \n\nThe former Governer-General James Andrew Broun-Ramsay, The Earl of Dalhousie, will be henceforth be crowned as Emperor Ramsay, the Honourable Emperor of the East Indian Empire. This is a glorious day!

Recent events in Calcutta have undermined the East India Company's loyalty to the Crown in matters of trade and the British monopoly on Indian goods is in danger, swift action must be taken to mend this.
The End of the East India Company
Parliament is understandably displeased with our recent change in policy and they now seek to undermine our rights and liquidate the company, clearly it is time for us to reevaluate our loyalties.
A Ship has arrived in Calcutta today carrying some delightful fruits of British ingenuity, we must put it to use straight away.

The recent rebellion in India has exposed structural weaknesses and inefficiencies in Company rule, for the good of the Indians and Empire we must liquidate the East India Company and bring their holdings under Crown rule. \n\n We hold ourselves bound to the natives of our Indian territories by the same obligation of duty which bind us to all our other subjects.

The East India Company since it's founding in 1600, eventually came to rule large areas of India with its own private armies, exercising military power and assuming administrative functionns of these areas.

The East India Company since it's founding in 1600, eventually came to rule large areas of India with its own private armies, exercising military power and assuming administrative functionns of these areas.

The East India Company since it's founding in 1600, eventually came to rule large areas of India with its own private armies, exercising military power and assuming administrative functionns of these areas.

The East India Company has defeated the British government and has asserted their rule of India an independent state. The company has restyled itself as $FROMCOUNTRY$ with the former Governer-General of India crowning himself as the 'Honourable Emperor of the East Indies' and has demanded that the former princely states under British influence now recognize $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ suzerainty in India.

The Treaty of Sugauli (also spelled Sugowlee, Sagauli and Segqulee), was the treaty that established the boundary line of Nepal, was signed on 2 December 1815 and ratified by 4 March 1816 between the East India Company and King of Nepal following the Anglo-Nepalese War of 1814-16. Among the terms of the treaty were that 'There shall be perpetual peace and friendship between the East India company and Nepal. \n\nNow with British influence is out of India, we should pressure the Nepalese government to recognize our new empire.

Ruling over such a huge population with a minority government is becoming increasingly difficult, one ethnic group we could look to for support is the Nepali people, many of which serve loyally in our Gurkha units. We could begin to reward the Nepali people for their services in our armies and to make them more loyal to our rule.

The White Rajahs were a dynastic monarchy of the English Brooke family, who founded and ruled the Kingdom of Sarawak, located on the island of Borneo and founded in 1841. The first ruler was Englishman James Brooke. As a reward for helping the Sultanate of Brunei fight piracy and insurgency among the indigenous peoples, he was granted the landmass of Sarawak in 1841 and received independent kingdom status. \n\nNominally under British influence up till now, but with the withdrawal of the British from India their ability to influence the Kingdom has been severely limited. In order to protect Sarawak from any Dutch incursions, as well as to gain a foothold in Borneo, we should pressure the Brooke government to become a vassal of $COUNTRY$

Prior to our successful rebellion from the British Crown, it has become increasingly difficult to govern India with a extremely limited pool of British settlers and former employees of the East India Company. Up till now our rule has been maintained through the support of the local aristocracy, but if we realistically  wish to have a long term minority-rule in India, it is imperative that we find ways to attract more white settlers to India.
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have remained defiant and have declared independence from both foreign rule altogether! We must respond to this act immediately!

The Indian Civil Service (ICS) for part of the 19th century officially known as the Imperial Civil Service, was the elite higher civil service of the British Empire in India during British rule in the period between 1858 and 1947. Up to 1853, the Directors of the East India Company made appointments of covenanted civil servants by nominations. This nomination system was abolished and it was decided that the induction would be through competitive examinations of all subjects, without distinction of race.
We will abide by their wishes.
Unruly vassals must be put in their place!
We shall declare our independence from British rule!
